abstracts.cdata!:
The project's outcome is highly
            satisfactory and sustainability is rated as highly likely.
            Bank performance at the lending stage was highly
            satisfactory and during supervision it was also
            satisfactory. Overall Borrower performance is rated as
            highly satisfactory. The project's success was due to
            the highly motivated commitment of the Hungarian Power
            Companies, which carried out much of the preparation before
            requesting Bank financing, to the use of a turnkey
            procurement contract for the main equipment, and to the
            absence of policy conditionality apart from standard
            financial covenants. The Bank was able to support the
            project under these conditions because of Hungary's
            demonstrated success in restructuring and privatizing the
            power sector, and in so doing, was particularly responsive
            to the client's expressed needs. Other lessons were
            that completing procurement prior to project effectiveness
            could greatly shorten the project implementation period; and
            that dealing with highly committed, competent, and
            experienced clients could greatly reduce costs to the Bank
            for project preparation and supervision.
